subject: Climate & Environment
title: Small Wind and Community Power
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Small Wind and Community Power.

hook.text: Not all wind turbines are giants. Some are small enough to fit on a rooftop.

buildup.text: Small turbines power farms, schools, and remote villages that the grid cannot reach.

discovery.text: Community wind projects let neighbors co-own a turbine and split the electricity.

twist.text: Denmark gets 50% of its power from wind â€” much of it from community-owned projects.

climax.text: Local ownership means profits stay in the town instead of going to distant utilities.

punchline.text: When the town owns the turbine, everyone shares the wind.

quiz.question: What percentage of Denmark's power comes from wind?
